Job Title: Evaluation of speech in English (US)
Job Description:
About Appen
Appen, a global AI leader, stands at the forefront with a network of over a million skilled contractors spanning 130 countries. We leverage cutting-edge AI-driven data annotation techniques to enhance AI systems for major tech companies and various industries. Our core values include a commitment to ethical AI and fostering a diverse and inclusive environment.
Interested in improving speech recognition technology? Then this is the project for you! You will type any name that you know how to pronounce (e.g. John) or see a name of a known person, location, product or organization. Then listen to the tool's pronunciation and rate it. In case it was poor, you will correct by recording yourself pronouncing it. Your contribution will be valuable in improving speech recognition technology!
It takes no more than 1 hour to complete 50 evaluations. In total you will submit between 50 and 200 evaluations on this project.
REQUIREMENTS:
- You must be a native speaker of English and reside in US
- 18 years old and above
- Have access to a laptop or PC
PAYMENT:
You will be contacted via email by a project team member when the project becomes available with a link and instructions on how to begin. The pay rate for evaluating 50 tasks/names is $20. If you proceed to submit 150 more, you will earn a total of $80. If you submit less than 50 tasks, it will not be compensated.

Job Title: On-site gig work opportunity in Birmingham (car activity)
Job Description:
About Appen
Appen, a global AI leader, stands at the forefront with a network of over a million skilled contractors spanning 130 countries. We leverage cutting-edge AI-driven data annotation techniques to enhance AI systems for major tech companies and various industries. Our core values include a commitment to ethical AI and fostering a diverse and inclusive environment.
Have a child and interested in improving car safety technology? This project is for you!
Your child/children will be sitting in a car and a camera will record their eye movements so the video can help train machine learning algorithms. The recording will not be shown anywhere else except for this purpose. The cars will be provided by Appen and you will accompanied by one of our data collection supervisors during the whole session.
REQUIREMENTS:
- Children from 0-4 years old
- Parents can communicate in English
- Willing to come to our venue in Birmingham, near the Aston rail station
PAYMENT:
- You will be paid up to £60 per child for 60 minutes of activity; Once done with the activity, you will receive a virtual gift card from
https://www.giftpay.co.uk/business/egifts.aspx
- Please note: the incentive amount is in UK Pound Sterling. It is the amount for completing the whole recording session, not per hour.
APPLY HERE, using this form:
https://forms.office.com/r/x6i1bdmADm
If selected, we will send you an email with a calendar to book a session.
If you are interested in work-from-home online jobs, you can apply using the button below "Apply for this job" in order to be registered in our platform and be informed about new opportunities before anyone else.

Job Title: One-time image collection (Belgium)
Job Description:
About Appen
Appen, a global AI leader, stands at the forefront with a network of over a million skilled contractors spanning 130 countries. We leverage cutting-edge AI-driven data annotation techniques to enhance AI systems for major tech companies and various industries. Our core values include a commitment to ethical AI and fostering a diverse and inclusive environment.
Interested in contributing to the advancement of AI technology that aims to revolutionize the online retail clothing industry.
- The task takes approximately 30-60 minutes to complete
- Due to project needs, each participant can only participate once.
- Your task involves collection of three key images—front profile, side profile, and selfie—along with 13 body measurements from each participant.
Requirements:
- All participants must be 18 years in age or older.
- Must be located in the country where your Appen account is registered when completing the task.
- Must have a smartphone (Android or iPhone).
- Must have a stable internet connection.
- Must download the Appen mobile app
- Must have a soft, flexible tape measure (not a rigid one).
- Must wear a tight clothing (leggings, lycra, undershirts, fitted tops, etc.)
- Must have a partner to help them in capturing the right measurement and taking the picture properly.
- Both individuals can contribute their measurements, taking turns with capturing photos, as long as they comply with the requirements.
- Payment for a completed individual session will be made to the person with the Appen account.
- Images must clearly show measurements and be of high-quality.
Payment:
- The task pay rate is listed next to the 'Options' button (on our website, Appen Connect)
- To earn the payrate, your session must pass our quality-checking phase according to the instructions provided to you. The payrate shown is the total amount you can earn for all 16 accepted images, not for each image. Unfortunately, due to project requirement each participant needs to have a maximum 16 accepted images for the session to be usable for AI training purposes and be eligible for full payment.

- Due to project needs, each participant can only participate once.
- Your task involves collection of three key images—front profile, side profile, and selfie—along with 13 body measurements from each participant.
Requirements:
- All participants must be 18 years in age or older.
- Must be located in the country where your Appen account is registered when completing the task.
- Must have a smartphone (Android or iPhone).
- Must have a stable internet connection.
- Must download the Appen mobile app
- Must have a soft, flexible tape measure (not a rigid one).
- Must wear a tight clothing (leggings, lycra, undershirts, fitted tops, etc.)
- Must have a partner to help them in capturing the right measurement and taking the picture properly.
- Both individuals can contribute their measurements, taking turns with capturing photos, as long as they comply with the requirements.
- Payment for a completed individual session will be made to the person with the Appen account.
- Images must clearly show measurements and be of high-quality.
Payment:
- The task pay rate is listed next to the 'Options' button (on our website, Appen Connect)
- To earn the payrate, your session must pass our quality-checking phase according to the instructions provided to you. The payrate shown is the total amount you can earn for all 16 accepted images, not for each image. Unfortunately, due to project requirement each participant needs to have a maximum 16 accepted images for the session to be usable for AI training purposes and be eligible for full payment.

Job Title: One-time speech collection task in Thai
Job Description:
About Appen
Appen, a global AI leader, stands at the forefront with a network of over a million skilled contractors spanning 130 countries. We leverage cutting-edge AI-driven data annotation techniques to enhance AI systems for major tech companies and various industries. Our core values include a commitment to ethical AI and fostering a diverse and inclusive environment.
ในโครงการนี้ Appen กำลังรวบรวมข้อมูลเสียงพูดในภาษาไทย เพื่อฝึกอบรมและพัฒนาอัลกอรึทึมของปัญญาประดิษฐ์เพื่อที่จะนำมาใช้ในการปรับปรุงเทคโนโลยีการรู้จำเสียงพูด
เรากำลังมองหาคนไทยเพื่ออ่านข้อความสั้น ๆ และบันทึกเสียงของคุณ โดยใช้แอพพลิเคชั่น Appen Mobile ของเรา
รายละเอียดงาน: ในงานนี้จะประกอบด้วยประโยคสั้น ๆ จำนวนทั้งหมด 1000 ประโยค คุณจะต้องอ่านประโยคสั้น ๆ ที่แสดงบนหน้าจอของคุณและบันทึกเสียงโดยใช้แอพพลิเคชั่น Appen Mobile คุณเพียงแค่ต้องอ่านตามประโยคที่เขียนใน ภาษาไทย ไม่จำเป็นต้องสร้างประโยคของคุณเอง
ตัวอย่างประโยคที่คุณจะต้องอ่าน: " โอเค Alexa ฉันต้องการเส้นทางไปที่ทำงาน"
ระยะเวลา: แต่ละประโยคจะใช้เวลาเพียง 3-10 วินาที โดยรวมแล้วสำหรับการบันทึก 1000 โปรดวางแผน 5 ชั่วโมง แน่นอนเราขอแนะนำให้คุณหยุดพักและเราจะให้คุณอย่างน้อย 7 วันเพื่อบันทึกเซสชั่นของคุณ
คุณสมบัติ
- มีสมาร์ทโฟน
- ต้องมีอายุมากกว่า 18 ปี
- ต้องเป็นเจ้าของภาษาไทยที่พำนักอยู่ในประเทศไทย
- สามารถบันทึกเสียงภายในอาคารที่เงียบสงบ ปราศจากเสียงรบกวนจากสภาพแวดล้อมรอบข้าง
การชำระเงิน
งานของคุณจะต้องผ่านการตรวจสอบคุณภาพ ตามแนวทางและข้อกำหนดของโครงการที่เราแจ้งไว้ อัตราค่าตอบแทนที่แสดงเป็นจำนวนเงินทั้งหมดที่คุณจะได้รับ 1000 เป็นจำนวนสำหรับการบันทึกเสียงที่ได้รับการตรวจสอบทั้งหมดในทุก ๆ คลิปเสียง (session) ไม่ใช่สำหรับการบันทึกในแต่ละประโยค หากผลงานทั้งหมดของคุณไม่ได้รับการยอมรับ คุณจะได้รับค่าตอบแทนตามสัดส่วนของคลิปเสียงที่ถูกต้องตามข้อกำหนดของโครงการ ตราบใดที่อย่างน้อย 80% ของคลิปเสียงของคุณทั้งหมมดได้รับการยอมรับและถูกต้องตามข้อกำหนด

Job Title: Onsite car activity in Sydney (Nov 2023-current/80 AUD)
Job Description:
About Appen
Appen, a global AI leader, stands at the forefront with a network of over a million skilled contractors spanning 130 countries. We leverage cutting-edge AI-driven data annotation techniques to enhance AI systems for major tech companies and various industries. Our core values include a commitment to ethical AI and fostering a diverse and inclusive environment.
This project is happening in Sydney, Australia. It aims to capture naturalistic glances around the cabin from drivers behind the wheel of a car. The data we collect are video recordings that will be used to improve road safety technology which detects the level of driver distraction. Around the world over a million road fatalities are attributed to driver fatigue or distraction. Help us improve the odds of staying alert at the wheel for people from all over the world in this multi ethnicity data collection.
The cars to do the session will be provided by Appen. Most of the participants will be doing the activities in stationary cars. The task takes approximately 90 minutes to complete.
REQUIREMENTS:
- Aged 21+
- Able to travel to Chatswood (Sydney, Australia) to take part in this project. If you are unable to travel to our offices, please do not register for this project.
- Good understanding of English
PAYMENT:
- Each in-car recording session will take approximately 90 minutes including receiving the instructions and signing some documents. We will aim to make it less.
- Once the session will be done, our supervisors will process your payment of 80 AUD in cash
- Please note: the incentive amount is in Australian Dollars. It is the amount for completing the whole recording session, not per hour. The incentive will be issued in cash on the day.
APPLY HERE, using this form:
https://forms.office.com/r/UYx6Zs4iQ3
Alternatively, you can apply using the button below "Apply for this job" in order to be registered in our platform and be informed about new opportunities before anyone else.

Job Title: Onsite car driving in Sydney (Oct 2023-current/150 AUD)
Job Description:
About Appen
Appen, a global AI leader, stands at the forefront with a network of over a million skilled contractors spanning 130 countries. We leverage cutting-edge AI-driven data annotation techniques to enhance AI systems for major tech companies and various industries. Our core values include a commitment to ethical AI and fostering a diverse and inclusive environment.
We're looking for individuals and families from various ethnic backgrounds to take part in our in-car video data collection project!
We have a new image data collection project that will be used to improve car-safety technology.
Like previous Sassafras projects, the data will be recorded in specially fitted Appen cars that capture the natural body movements of all occupants in a car.
Your task (or somebody who comes with you) will be to drive one of our cars for about 90 minutes. While driving, all you need to do is act naturally, as you would driving any other car. For example, look at the mirrors, set the radio, check the sat-nav or maybe even sing songs with your passengers (or at least talk to them!)
The route will be predetermined by Appen. In that time you will need to stop several times, take some in-car photos, change your appearance (hat/no hat, sweater/no sweater etc.) and even change seat positions.
Please be aware that you will never be asked to perform anything dangerous while driving and that safety is our primary concern.
In this Sassafras Project S, we encourage participants to bring their families, i.e. parents, kids, siblings or friends, and even pets. Recordings will be done with up to 5 occupants.
The data collected will be used for learning purposes to improve driver fatigue and driver distraction recognition technology.
Recordings will be scheduled from Mondays to Saturdays to make it a little easier to bring children.
Some recordings will take place at dusk or night.
ALL DRIVERS MUST POSSESS A CURRENT FULL LICENSE AND BE AT LEAST 21 YEARS OLD.
Payment
Fixed price of $150 cash for adult individuals
Fixed price of $50 cash for children under 18 years of age
This project is paid by task and not at an hourly rate.
The session will take approximately 120 minutes. This is an in-person project, therefore you must come to our location in Chatswood, Sydney area to participate in the project.
People who have participate in previous Sassafras project are also eligible to take part in PSP2
APPLY HERE, using this form:
https://forms.office.com/r/E4AGxyYFnw
Alternatively, you can apply using the button below "Apply for this job" in order to be registered in our platform and be informed about new opportunities before anyone else.
If you have any questions please reach out to Yumiko at ytakaku@appen.com or Greg at glopresti@appen.com

Job Title: Social Media Evaluator (Gig-Worker); English - Pakistan
Job Description:
About Appen
Appen, a global AI leader, stands at the forefront with a network of over a million skilled contractors spanning 130 countries. We leverage cutting-edge AI-driven data annotation techniques to enhance AI systems for major tech companies and various industries. Our core values include a commitment to ethical AI and fostering a diverse and inclusive environment.
Our project, Detecting Lies on Social Media, is all about getting people like you involved in finding and researching fake information online. We want to focus on things that happened recently and could cause some real problems if people believe them.
How We Do It:
- Check the Facts: We want you to compare what's said in social media posts with reliable information to see if it's true.
- Keep Up with What's Happening:
- Use Trending Maps: Check maps that show what's popular to guide your searches.
- Watch for Repeat Liars: Find and keep an eye on people or places that often share fake stuff.
- Try Different Ways: Look at other sources and try different methods to find out what's not true.
- What We're Looking For:
For a post to be worth checking, it must:
- Come from social media and be recent (within the last 7 or 14 days).
- Be about something that could seriously fool people, not just little mistakes.
- Not be just someone's opinion, a joke, or a fight between businesses.
What You Need to Show:
- Make sure it doesn't have any made-up info, missing details, or fake pictures.
- Check it's from the last week or two and has at least 15 shares or comments (or 100 views if it's a video).
- Make sure you haven't sent us the same thing before.
- Share the link to the post.
- Give us a link to proof, like a fact-checking site.
- Summarize what the post is saying and how you checked it.
How to Find Stuff to Check:
- Use Google to find out what people are talking about.
- Look at the news on Google to see what's going on.
- Try different searches and look for what's popular.
- Check social media for pages that often share things that aren't true, especially if they're talking about hot topics.
Key Requirements:
- Must be currently located in Pakistan
- Be fluent and proficient in English
- Must be able to provide your valid social media profile
- Must have an educational degree
By joining in, you're helping make social media a more honest and reliable place. Together, we can stop the spread of lies online!

Job Title: One-time speech collection task in Aboriginal Australian English
Job Description:
About Appen
Appen, a global AI leader, stands at the forefront with a network of over a million skilled contractors spanning 130 countries. We leverage cutting-edge AI-driven data annotation techniques to enhance AI systems for major tech companies and various industries. Our core values include a commitment to ethical AI and fostering a diverse and inclusive environment.
Are you interested in improving speech recognition technology by reducing bias? If yes, then this project is for you!
Complete a two-part audio recording task using our Appen Mobile app:
Part 1: Scripted - Read and record a provided script alone (5 minutes).
Part 2: Conversational - Record a natural and spontaneous conversation with a friend or family member. Topics and script guides will be provided (5 minutes).
Important Note: Please be aware that the contents of this project may be sensitive, explicit, or otherwise triggering. If you have any questions, please reach out to us.
Duration:
The entire task will take you approximately 15 - 20 minutes to complete, including reading the guidelines and recording your voice.
Payment:
The task pay rate is $70. To earn the pay rate, your session must pass our quality-checking phase according to the instructions provided to you. The pay rate shown is the total amount you can earn for a fully accepted session including a scripted and a conversational part, not for each recording.
To qualify for payment, your submission must include completing both parts of the task. Additionally, each part should pass the quality checking at least 90% of the total audio recording (4 minutes and 30 seconds for each part). Failure to meet these criteria will result in no payment being made.
Due to project needs, each participant needs to successfully complete both parts in order for the session to be usable for AI training purposes.
Requirements:
• Native speaker of the Aboriginal Australian English
• Aged 18 and above
• Have a friend or family member who could potentially do the conversational part of this project (any accent would be ok)
• Have access to a smartphone

Appen, a global AI leader, stands at the forefront with a network of over a million skilled contractors spanning 130 countries. We leverage cutting-edge AI-driven data annotation techniques to enhance AI systems for major tech companies and various industries. Our core values include a commitment to ethical AI and fostering a diverse and inclusive environment.
Are you interested in improving speech recognition technology by reducing bias? If yes, then this project is for you!
Complete a two-part audio recording task using our Appen Mobile app:
Part 1: Scripted - Read and record a provided script alone (5 minutes).
Part 2: Conversational - Record a natural and spontaneous conversation with a friend or family member. Topics and script guides will be provided (5 minutes).
Important Note: Please be aware that the contents of this project may be sensitive, explicit, or otherwise triggering. If you have any questions, please reach out to us.
Duration:
The entire task will take you approximately 15 - 20 minutes to complete, including reading the guidelines and recording your voice.
Payment:
The task pay rate is $70. To earn the pay rate, your session must pass our quality-checking phase according to the instructions provided to you. The pay rate shown is the total amount you can earn for a fully accepted session including a scripted and a conversational part, not for each recording.
To qualify for payment, your submission must include completing both parts of the task. Additionally, each part should pass the quality checking at least 90% of the total audio recording (4 minutes and 30 seconds for each part). Failure to meet these criteria will result in no payment being made.
Due to project needs, each participant needs to successfully complete both parts in order for the session to be usable for AI training purposes.
Requirements:
• You must be an Indigenous Canadian English native speaker
• Aged 18 and above
• Have a friend or family member who could potentially do the conversational part of this project (any accent would be ok)
• Have access to a smartphone

Job Title: At Home Security Camera Video collection - US
Job Description:
AI Home Security Project. Help train security cameras to detect your state as you enter/exit spaces in your home! We will lend you a security camera to be able to complete the task.
You will be doing 14 videos of 3 different scenarios. Each scenario's videos should total 1.5-5 mins. Get paid for completing all videos and passing all quality requirements. You can earn more if you have family members/friends within the same household who participate in the project!
DURATION:
- 25-30 seconds per video
- Up to 2 minutes per scenario
- Approximately 45 minutes to 1 hour to complete all the videos.
PAYMENT:
- The task pay rate is $125 - $250.
- To earn the full $250 payment, all your videos should pass our quality checks.
- We will pay an additional $125 for each family member who completes the task with all videos also passing quality checks
REQUIREMENTS:
- Must be 18 years old and above
- A laptop/desktop computer to do be able to view project pages/guidelines
- Have enough room in their household to setup a camera, approximately 10-15 feet of space between a door and placing a camera.

Job Title: Chatbot interaction (Mexico)
Job Description:
Interested in improving speech recognition technology? Then this is the project for you! You will interact with an AI assistant by recording between 50 and 100 short questions or commands and then rating the AI assistant's responses. Your contribution will be valuable in improving speech recognition technology!
There will be 2 task types each including 50 tasks. The estimated time to complete all 100 tasks is around 1.5 hours.
REQUIREMENTS:

-You must have a Native or Bilingual level of English
-18 years old and above
-Have access to a laptop or PC

You will be contacted via email by a project team member when the project becomes available with a link and instructions on how to begin. The pay rate for submitting 100 commands is $40. Anything over 50 submissions per task type will not be compensated. If you complete fewer items, you will be paid proportionately.

Job Title: Speech collection tasks in English (Mexico)
Job Description:
The aim of this project is to improve speech recognition technology. All you need to do is to read aloud short sentences in English as naturally as possible, but ensure words are pronounced with Mexican accent, and record your speech. All sentences will appear on your phone while using our Appen Mobile App.
**English_Mexico: 102 sentences to record; approximately 45 min. to complete; full payrate is $15
(English_Mexico)
"Hey, what is the best beach Cancun?"
"Hey, what is the biggest city in Mexico?"

-Speaker must be bilingual and able to read and understand English.
-Speaker must have strong local Mexican accent
-18 years old and above
-Have access to an Android or iOS device
PAYMENT:
The payrate shown of $15 for the task is the total amount you can earn for the accepted 102 recordings, not for each recording. If your entire task is not accepted, you will be paid proportionally for each accepted recording, as long as at least 90% of your session is accepted.
Note: Once active in the project and if you are selected to complete the task, we will contact you with a welcome email containing your app login details (PIN). You will have a 48 hour deadline based on the timestamp from that email to complete your assigned task.

Job Description:
Come and join the Appen community and join Project Armanda where your gig-work skills will be put to the test.
This gig work project consists of ongoing ad-hoc tasks in which you will be asked to rate a series of text-to-speech clips. - Stable internet connection.
-
Native speaker of US Spanish
, currently located in the United States.
No particular skillset required, you will be provided training and qualifications before proceeding to the task at hand.
Please note that this project may be subject to the client's demographic requirements, and your application to the project in Appen is an expression of interest only - we cannot guarantee a spot to all who apply.

Job Title: Response Evaluator - Independent Contractor (6 week project)
Job Description:
Join the Appen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Aralia, contributing to the advancement of AI technology. In this 6-8 week project, you will play a crucial role in evaluating model responses to various commands, aiding in the refinement and improvement of AI algorithms.
Responsibilities:
Read a prompt and evaluate two model responses to each. Use the criteria provided to judge each answer based on three things: whether it's harmless, honest, and helpful. Rate responses based on predetermined criteria by answering several questions. Compare the answers to see which one is better overall and by how much. Maintain a high level of accuracy and consistency in evaluations.
Key Details:
- Each unit (command and model responses) takes approximately 5 minutes to evaluate.
- Contractors have the flexibility to work on an unlimited number of units.
- Compensation is based on the hours spent actively working in the evaluation tool.
Requirements:
- Fluent/native speaker of English.
- Residing in the United States.
- Age 18 or above.
- Access to a laptop or PC.
Qualifications:
- Sign relevant project contracts and/ or agreements.
- Complete a short 5-minute survey.
- Complete a Guidelines Quiz (approx. 15mins) to ensure you understand LLM based modelling.
- Complete a Task Test (approx. 30 minutes) to ensure you understand the project and the work that will need to be done.
- Complete an identity check to validate your identity.
We're seeking individuals with a strong work ethic, commitment to quality, and attention to detail. Ideally, you can commit to 25+ hours per week over a 6-8 week period. Enjoy the benefits of remote and independent work, offering schedule flexibility.
Apply to the project today, access available resources to guide, educate, and test your task proficiency.
Join us in shaping the future of AI technology. Apply now to become a vital part of the Aralia project!

Job Title: Social Media Ads Evaluator (Native Japanese Speaker)
Job Description:
Job Description:
We are seeking a native Japanese speaker residing in Japan to join the Appen Community as a Social Media Ads Evaluator. In this Independent Contractor role, you will evaluate the relevance, appropriateness, and accuracy of social media advertisements, contributing valuable insights to improve online advertising strategies.
Key Responsibilities:
- Evaluate the relevance and appropriateness of social media ads by assessing their usefulness and accuracy.
- Utilize an external platform to rate ads and identify any misleading content.
- Gain insights into people's preferences regarding online advertisements and understand the reasons behind their preferences.
- Share your perspective on ads within the platform.
- Engage daily by logging into the designated social media site to assess and rate a batch of ads aligned with your unique interests.
- Commit to spending one hour daily, five days a week, evaluating ads exclusively on a personal computer (desktop/laptop).
- Demonstrate a willingness to view and evaluate potentially offensive content.
Requirements:
- Native Japanese speaker residing in Japan.
- Access to a personal computer (desktop/laptop) and a stable internet connection.
- Strong attention to detail and analytical skills.
- Ability to commit to one hour of work daily, five days a week.
- Willingness to view and evaluate potentially offensive content.
- Excellent communication skills.
If you are ready to embark on this fantastic opportunity to earn from the comfort of your own home at your convenience, we encourage you to apply today!
Please note that due to the nature of this opportunity, only candidates residing in Japan and who are native Japanese speakers will be considered.
If you are successful in your application, you will be sent an email to set up and finalize an account set up on Appen Connect, your gateway into this project. Once you have reset your password, you will be registered to the project which can be found in your 'Applied' tab. From here you can complete the required qualification steps in preparation for onboarding and your first earnings.

Job Title: Social Media Evaluator (Gig-Worker); Hebrew - Israel
Job Description:
Our project, Detecting Lies on Social Media, is all about getting people like you involved in finding and researching fake information online. We want to focus on things that happened recently and could cause some real problems if people believe them.
How We Do It:
- Check the Facts: We want you to compare what's said in social media posts with reliable information to see if it's true.
- Keep Up with What's Happening:
- Use Trending Maps: Check maps that show what's popular to guide your searches.
- Watch for Repeat Liars: Find and keep an eye on people or places that often share fake stuff.
- Try Different Ways: Look at other sources and try different methods to find out what's not true.
- What We're Looking For:
For a post to be worth checking, it must:
- Come from social media and be recent (within the last 7 or 14 days).
- Be about something that could seriously fool people, not just little mistakes.
- Not be just someone's opinion, a joke, or a fight between businesses.
What You Need to Show:
- Make sure it doesn't have any made-up info, missing details, or fake pictures.
- Check it's from the last week or two and has at least 15 shares or comments (or 100 views if it's a video).
- Make sure you haven't sent us the same thing before.
- Share the link to the post.
- Give us a link to proof, like a fact-checking site.
- Summarize what the post is saying and how you checked it.
How to Find Stuff to Check:
- Use Google to find out what people are talking about.
- Look at the news on Google to see what's going on.
- Try different searches and look for what's popular.
- Check social media for pages that often share things that aren't true, especially if they're talking about hot topics.
Key Requirements:
- Must be currently located in Israel
- Be fluent and proficient in English and Hebrew
- Must be able to provide your valid social media profile
- Must have an educational degree
By joining in, you're helping make social media a more honest and reliable place. Together, we can stop the spread of lies online!

Job Title: Text-Based AI Instruction Specialist (France)
Job Description:
We are seeking a Text-Based AI Instruction Specialist to join our innovative project focused on refining and enhancing the capabilities of advanced text-based AI. This role involves creating and refining instructions for the AI, ensuring it accurately understands and generates human language.
Key Responsibilities:
- Write and refine commands for the AI to improve its language understanding and generation.
- Review and evaluate AI responses to ensure accuracy and appropriateness.
- Develop a wide variety of questions and topics to simulate potential user interactions with the chatbot.
- Ensure all questions and content are varied, free from harmful or biased material.
- Produce high-quality, original written content without any plagiarism.
- Proofread and edit content meticulously to eliminate misspellings and grammatical errors.
- Understand and apply complex guidelines and requirements.
Key Requirements:
- Must currently reside in France.
- Native language speakers and individuals with non-native accents are both welcome to fulfill the project's goals.
- High proficiency in written language with impeccable grammar and spelling.
- Excellent proofreading skills with a strong attention to detail.
- Ability to comprehend and apply complex guidelines effectively.
Qualification:
This role is a project-based opportunity with Appen, where you will join the Appen Connect Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from Appen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
Once logged in, you will be required to complete the following project qualifications:
- Language proficiency quiz (approx. 20-30 minutes)
- LLM-based quiz (approx. 15 minutes)
- LLM guidelines quiz (approx. 10 minutes)
- Project-specific test quiz (approx. 15 minutes)
If you are a creative thinker with a passion for language and AI, ready to embark on a journey as an LLM specialist, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity!

- Understand and apply complex guidelines and requirements.
Key Requirements:
- Must currently reside in Spain.
- Native language speakers and individuals with non-native accents are both welcome to fulfill the project's goals.
- High proficiency in written language with impeccable grammar and spelling.
- Excellent proofreading skills with a strong attention to detail.
- Ability to comprehend and apply complex guidelines effectively.
Qualification:
This role is a project-based opportunity with Appen, where you will join the Appen Connect Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from Appen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
Once logged in, you will be required to complete the following project qualifications:
- Language proficiency quiz (approx. 20-30 minutes)
- LLM-based quiz (approx. 15 minutes)
- LLM guidelines quiz (approx. 10 minutes)
- Project-specific test quiz (approx. 15 minutes)
If you are a creative thinker with a passion for language and AI, ready to embark on a journey as an LLM specialist, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity!

Job Title: Social Media Evaluator (Gig-Worker); Hindi-India
Job Description:
Join the Appen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Uolo-P. Our project, detecting lies on Social Media, is all about getting people like you involved in finding and researching fake information online. We want to focus on things that happened recently and could cause some real problems if people believe them.
How We Do It:
- Check the Facts: We want you to compare what's said in social media posts with reliable information to see if it's true.
- Keep Up with What's Happening:
- Use Trending Maps: Check maps that show what's popular to guide your searches.
- Watch for Repeat Liars: Find and keep an eye on people or places that often share fake stuff.
- Try Different Ways: Look at other sources and try different methods to find out what's not true.
- What We're Looking For:
For a post to be worth checking, it must:
- Come from social media and be recent (within the last 7 or 14 days).
- Be about something that could seriously fool people, not just little mistakes.
- Not be just someone's opinion, a joke, or a fight between businesses.
What You Need to Show:
- Make sure it doesn't have any made-up info, missing details, or fake pictures.
- Check it's from the last week or two and has at least 15 shares or comments (or 100 views if it's a video).
- Make sure you haven't sent us the same thing before.
- Share the link to the post.
- Give us a link to proof, like a fact-checking site.
- Summarize what the post is saying and how you checked it.
How to Find Stuff to Check:
- Use Google to find out what people are talking about.
- Look at the news on Google to see what's going on.
- Try different searches and look for what's popular.
- Check social media for pages that often share things that aren't true, especially if they're talking about hot topics.
Key Requirements:
- Must be currently located in India
- Be fluent in Hindi and have proficiency in English
- Must be able to provide your valid social media profile
- Must have an educational degree
If your application is successful, you will receive an email from Appen regarding setting up your personalized account in Appen Connect. From here you simply reset your password to gain access to your account and the project will be ready and waiting!
By joining in, you're helping make social media a more honest and reliable place. Together, we can stop the spread of lies online!

Job Title: Speech collection tasks in English (Australia)
Job Description:
Join us in revolutionizing speech recognition technology! Engage with us effortlessly by reading short English sentences aloud using our intuitive and user-friendly Appen Mobile App. Each sentence seamlessly appears on your phone screen, making the process both convenient and enjoyable.
Task: read 400 sentences. It should take you approximately 3 hours.
Example of sentences:
"Hey, let's call Maryam"
"Hey, call Esteban on my phone at work"
REQUIREMENTS:
-Must be comfortable reading and speaking English sentences while residing in Australia.
-You need to have an accent of your local language (Australia)
-18 years old and above
-Have access to an Android or iOS device
PAYMENT:
The task pay rate can be found next to the 'Options' button on our website, Appen CrowdGen. You will receive the specified pay rate for your task once it is completed according to our instructions and fully accepted during the quality-checking phase. If your entire task is not accepted, you will be paid proportionally for each accepted recording, provided that at least (90-419) of your sentences are accepted. Please note, the pay rate displayed represents the total amount you can earn for all accepted recordings—400 for each task type —not per individual recording.
Note: Once you are active in the project and selected to complete the task, we will contact you with a welcome email containing your app login details (PIN). **Remember, you have a window of 24-48 hours (2 days) to complete the task. If not, the PIN will expire, and the task will be reassigned to another participant. So, seize the opportunity—it's first come, first served!

Job Title: Social Media Evaluator (Arabic-Jordan)
Job Description:
Join the Appen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Uolo-P. Our project, detecting lies on Social Media, is all about getting people like you involved in finding and researching fake information online. We want to focus on things that happened recently and could cause some real problems if people believe them.
How We Do It:
- Check the Facts: We want you to compare what's said in social media posts with reliable information to see if it's true.
- Use Trending Maps: Check maps that show what's popular to guide your searches.
- Watch for Repeat Liars: Find and keep an eye on people or places that often share fake stuff.
- Try Different Ways: Look at other sources and try different methods to find out what's not true.
What We're Looking For:
For a post to be worth checking, it must:
- Come from Facebook or Instagram and be recent (within the last 7 or 14 days).
- Be about something that could seriously fool people, not just little mistakes.
- Not be just someone's opinion, a joke, or a fight between businesses.
What You Need to Show:
- Make sure it doesn't have any made-up info, missing details, or fake pictures.
- Check it's from the last week or two and has at least 15 shares or comments (or 100 views if it's a video).
- Make sure you haven't sent us the same thing before.
- Share the link to the post.
- Give us a link to proof, like a fact-checking site.
- Summarize what the post is saying and how you checked it.
How to Find Stuff to Check:
- Use Google to find out what people are talking about.
- Look at the news on Google to see what's going on.
- Try different searches and look for what's popular.
- Check social media for pages that often share things that aren't true, especially if they're talking about hot topics.
Key Requirements:
- Must be currently located in Jordan
- Be fluent in Arabic and have proficiency in English
- Must be able to provide your valid Facebook profile
- Must have an educational degree
If your application is successful, you will receive an email from Appen regarding setting up your personalized account in Appen Connect. From here you simply reset your password to gain access to your account and the project will be ready and waiting!
By joining in, you're helping make social media a more honest and reliable place. Together, we can stop the spread of lies online!

Job Title: Arabic Audio Recording Contributor (Egypt)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Ayla. Are you a smartphone user looking to participate in a simple and engaging audio recording project? We invite you to be part of our initiative with Appen, where we’re collecting speech data in Arabic to enhance artificial intelligence and speech recognition technologies!
Project Details:
Location:
Egypt
Task:
You will read and record 50 short sentences using the Appen Mobile app. No need to create your own sentences; just follow the prompts on your screen!
Example prompt: "مرحباً، سيري اقرأ بريدي الإلكتروني."
Duration:
Each sentence takes just 3-10 seconds to record. Expect to spend around 20-30 minutes total, with at least 48 hours to complete your recordings.
Payment:
Earn a fixed amount for 50 accepted recordings. If some are not accepted, you’ll be compensated proportionally for each accepted recording, provided at least 80% are approved.
Requirements:
- Must have a smartphone (recent model, within the last 6 years)
- 18 years or older
- Native Arabic speaker
- Ability to record in a quiet indoor environment, free from background noise
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
If you’re excited about contributing to the improvement of Arabic speech recognition technology, we’d love to have you on board!

Job Title: Speech Data Collection (Netherlands)
Job Description:
Sluit je aan bij het CrowdGen-team als een onafhankelijke opdrachtnemer voor Project Amer. In dit project verzamelt Appen Nederlandse spraakdata om kunstmatige intelligentiealgoritmes te trainen en ontwikkelen die gebruikt zullen worden bij het verbeteren van spraakherkenningstechnologieën.
We zoeken personen in Nederland die korte zinnen willen voorlezen en opnemen in onze Appen Mobile-app.
⭐Taak:
De taak bevat in totaal 50 korte zinnen die je moet voorlezen vanaf een scherm en moet opnemen met de Appen Mobile-app. Je hoeft alleen maar de Nederlandse zinnen te volgen, je eigen zinnen creëren is niet nodig. Voorbeeld van een zin die je zou moeten voorlezen: “Oké Alexa, ik heb werkinstructies nodig.”
⭐Duur:
Elke zin duurt gemiddeld 3 tot 6 seconden. In totaal zul je voor 50 zinnen dus zo’n 1 uur nodig hebben. Natuurlijk bevelen we je aan pauzes in te lassen en daarom krijg je minstens 2 dagen de tijd om je sessie te voltooien.
⭐Betaling:
We betalen je $8.76 USD voor dit project. Betaling zal geschieden nadat ALLE 50 opnames zijn ingeleverd en goedgekeurd. Als je minder dan 50 zinnen goed hebt uitgevoerd, zullen we je naar rato uitbetalen met een acceptatiegraad van minstens 80%.
Eisen:
- Je bent in het bezit van een moderne smartphone
- iOs-apparaat moet een iPhone 8 of nieuwer zijn
- Android-apparaten moeten uit 2017 of nieuwer zijn
- Je bent minimaal 18 jaar oud
- Nederlands is je moedertaal en je woont in Nederland
- Je kunt werken in een stille omgeving, zonder achtergrondgeluiden
Deze functie is een projectgebaseerde mogelijkheid bij CrowdGen, waarbij je deel zult uitmaken van de CrowdGen-community als onafhankelijke opdrachtnemer. Als je wordt geselecteerd, ontvang je een e-mail van CrowdGen over het aanmaken van een account met het e-mailadres dat je hebt gebruikt bij je sollicitatie. Je moet inloggen op dit account, het wachtwoord resetten, de vereiste instellingen voltooien en doorgaan met je sollicitatie voor deze projectgebaseerde functie.
Laten we beginnen als je er klaar voor bent om deel te nemen aan deze interessante audio-opnametaak!

Job Title: Speech Data Collection (Poland)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Angrapa. Are you a smartphone user interested in a simple and engaging audio recording project? Look no further! CrowdGen is collecting Polish speech data to train and improve artificial intelligence algorithms for speech recognition technologies.
We’re seeking participants in Poland to read and record short prompts using the Appen Mobile app.
Task Details:
What to do: Read and record 50 short sentences displayed on your screen using the Appen Mobile app. No need to create your own sentences.
Example sentence: "Hej, Siri przeczytała moją wiadomość e-mail."
Duration:
Each sentence takes 3–10 seconds to record. For all 50 recordings, plan for about 20–30 minutes in total. You’ll have 48 hours to complete the task, with breaks encouraged.
Payment:
The pay rate is listed next to the 'Options' button on our website or under the project name in the Appen Mobile app. The total pay applies to 50 accepted recordings. If some are rejected, you'll be paid proportionally, as long as at least 80% of your session is approved.
Requirements:
- A smartphone (from the past 6 years)
- 18 years or older
- Native Polish speaker
- Able to record in a quiet indoor environment, free of background noise

Job Title: Speech Data Collection (Turkey)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Ankara. Do you have a smartphone and want to participate in an easy, engaging project? CrowdGen is collecting speech data in Turkish to help train AI algorithms and improve speech recognition technologies.
We’re looking for individuals in Turkey to read and record short prompts using our Appen Mobile app.
Task Details:
Task: Read and record 50 short sentences displayed on the screen using the Appen Mobile app.
Example: "Hey, Siri e-postamı oku."
Duration:
Each sentence takes 3-10 seconds. Expect to spend around 20-30 minutes total. You’ll have 48 hours to complete the recordings, so feel free to take breaks.
Payment:
The pay rate is listed on Appen Connect (next to the 'Options' button) or in the Appen Mobile app (under the project name). To receive full payment, your session must pass our quality check. You’ll be paid for each accepted recording, as long as 80% of your session meets the required quality standards.
Requirements:
- Own a smartphone (released within the last 6 years)
- Be 18 years or older
- Native Turkish speaker
- Able to record in a quiet indoor environment without background noise

Job Title: ID Document Data Collection Contractor (Australia)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Dovetail, an advancement of ID document recognition technology! CrowdGen is seeking participants to help train and test automated ID document recognition algorithms by capturing photos and videos of various ID documents.
Responsibilities:
- Capture 10 photos and 10 five-second videos of the front and back sides of your ID documents (driver's license, passport, Medicare card, other identification cards, gun license, or boat license).
- Use different locations, lighting, and backgrounds to improve document detection accuracy across diverse environments.
- Complete a total of 10 tasks (1 photo + 1 video for each task). You can submit up to three different ID documents.
The task will take approximately 10 to 20 minutes to complete.
Requirements:
- Must be 18 years or older.
- Must be a resident of
Australia
.
- Must have valid, non-expired ID documents (driver's license, passport, Medicare card, other identification cards, gun license, or boat license).
- Access to a stable internet connection, an Android or iOS smartphone, and a secondary device to scan QR codes.
Compensation:
Payment is provided for each accepted ID document submission (photos + videos). All 10 photos and 10 videos must be accepted for the submission to qualify for payment.

Job Title: Cote d’Ivoire AI Transcription Specialist (Bambara)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Vicuna. Join our team to help build AI-powered speech recognition and moderation models! By working on this project, you will contribute to the development of responsible, unbiased AI technology.
As an AI Transcription Specialist, you will be responsible for producing highly accurate transcriptions of speech in Bambara. Your efforts will play a key role in improving AI-powered communication tools. This project focuses on developing advanced speech recognition models for the Bambara language.
Key Responsibilities:
- Accurately transcribe audio files in Bambara, following the provided transcription guidelines.
- Ensure high-quality transcriptions to help develop AI speech recognition models.
- Apply linguistic knowledge to ensure correct spelling, grammar, and pronunciation.
Requirements:
- Must be based in Cote d’Ivoire.
- Native proficiency in Bambara (required).
- Bilingual skills in French and/or Arabic (preferred).
- Strong attention to detail and an understanding of basic linguistic concepts.
- Good reading comprehension skills in both Bambara and English.
- Ability to follow guidelines and apply rules to data accurately.
- Familiarity with Bambara spelling conventions.
- Prior experience in transcription and annotation of acoustic data.
- Stable internet connection.
- Experience with online gaming is a plus but not required.
Qualification Process:
Bambara Language Proficiency: You must pass a language comprehension quiz with a score of at least 80% (3 attempts allowed).
Transcription Guidelines Quiz: You must score at least 85% on a medium-complexity transcription guidelines quiz (2 attempts allowed).

Job Title: Transcription Specialist - Numbat Project (Mandarin Language)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Numbat. As a Transcription Specialist for the Numbat project, you will play a key role in contributing to the development of cutting-edge AI-powered speech recognition models. Your task is to provide accurate and high-quality transcriptions following specific guidelines and tagging conventions. The transcriptions you produce will support the creation of inclusive and unbiased AI technologies that enhance communication across languages, dialects, accents, and modes of communication.
Key Responsibilities:
- Transcribe audio recordings in the
Mandarin language (Wuhan, Dongbei and Shanghai dialects)
with a focus on accuracy and adherence to guidelines.
- Apply specified tagging conventions and make any necessary annotations.
- Deliver transcriptions that support the development of advanced AI speech recognition models.
- Ensure high-quality output in line with project expectations and AI specialist standards.

- Must live in
China
and be familiar with one of these dialects:
Wuhan, Dongbei and Shanghai
- Attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality work.
- Familiarity with transcription guidelines or willingness to learn.
- Ability to work efficiently with provided tools and meet deadlines.
Compensation:
Payments will be based on the actual duration of the audio you submit. The displayed pay rate corresponds to what you would earn for completing and submitting 3,600 seconds (1 hour) of audio. Once familiar with the guidelines, data, and tools, most transcribers are expected to transcribe 12 minutes of audio within 60 minutes.

Job Title: Voice Data Contributor (Korean)
Job Description:
프로젝트 안동을 위한 독립 계약자로 CrowdGen 팀에 합류하세요. 귀하께서 참여자로 선정되면, 이메일을 통해 앱 로그인에 필요한 정보 (두 개의 PIN) 각각 발송될 것입니다. 참여할 수 있는 기회가 한정적임을 염두해 주세요. 기다려 주셔서 감사드립니다.
이 프로젝트에서 Appen 은 음성 인식 기술을 개선하는데 사용될 인공지능 알고리즘을 훈련하고 개발하기 위해 한국어 음성 데이터를 수집합니다.
저희는 Appen Mobile 앱을 사용하여 짧은 한국어 문장을 읽고 녹음할 수 있는 한국인을 모집하고 있습니다.
⭐ 프로젝트 내용: Appen Mobile 앱을 사용하여 스마트폰 화면에 나오는 50개의 짧은 문장을 읽고 녹음하는 업무입니다. 문장을 따로 만들어낼 필요 없이 한국어로 쓰여진 문장들을 읽기만 하면 됩니다.
귀하께서 읽어야 할 문장의 예시: “오케이 알렉사, 회사 가는 길을 알려줘”
⭐ 소요 시간: 각 문장을 녹음하는 데 평균 3~6초가 걸립니다. 총 50개의 문장을 녹음하려면 30분을 계획하세요. 물론 녹음하는 동안 휴식을 취하는 것이 좋으며 모든 문장을 녹음하는 데 최소 2일의 시간이 주어집니다.
⭐ 보수: 이 프로젝트에 대한 보상으로 미화 15.16달러를 지급합니다. 50개의 녹음이 모두 제출되고 모두 품질 검사를 통과하면 보상이 지급됩니다. 품질 검사를 통과한 녹음이 50개 미만인 경우, 80% 이상 통과한 녹음의 문장 수에 비례하여 보상이 지급됩니다.
프로젝트 참여 요건:
-최신 스마트폰 기기 소유자
iOS 기기는 반드시 iPhone 8 혹은 그 이상이어야 함
Android 는 반드시 2017년 혹은 그 이후에 나온 기기이어야 함
-18세 이상이어야 함
-한국에 거주하는 한국어 모국어 사용자이어야 함
- 배경 소음이 전혀 없고 아주 조용한 실내 환경에서 녹음할 수 있어야 함
이 역할은 CrowdGen과의 프로젝트 기반 기회로, 독립 계약자로서 CrowdGen 커뮤니티에 합류하게 됩니다. 선정되면, 지원 시 사용한 이메일 주소로 계정 생성에 관한 CrowdGen의 이메일을 받게 됩니다. 해당 계정에 로그인한 후, 비밀번호를 재설정하고 설정 요구 사항을 완료한 뒤, 이 프로젝트 기반 역할에 대한 지원 절차를 진행해야 합니다.
만약 이 흥미로운 음성 녹음 프로젝트에 참여할 준비가 되셨다면, 이제 시작해봅시다!

Job Title: Social Media Evaluator (Content Analyst); Chinese-Taiwan
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Calathea.
Do you love exploring Threads? Then, this project is tailor-made for you!
About the Project:
Project Calathea is dedicated to enhancing the Threads recommendation ecosystem by diving into the world of content analysis. We’re collecting labels for key attributes like originality, bait, and other objective elements specific to threads. Your contributions will play a vital role in measuring these attributes accurately and building a robust classifier that will help refine the recommendation system, improving the user experience for millions.
Who Are We Looking For?:
We’re seeking passionate individuals with a deep interest in social media and content analysis. Ideal candidates will possess the following:
- Critical Thinking: Ability to assess and evaluate the content of threads, determining whether they are original, bait, or contain other objective attributes.
- Attention to Detail: A sharp eye for examining the subtle nuances in posts to ensure accurate labeling. Small differences can be crucial in distinguishing between types of content.
- Understanding of Social Media Dynamics: Familiarity with how platforms like Threads work, including the types of posts, trends, and what makes content engaging or misleading.
- Objectivity and Impartiality: The ability to judge content fairly, setting personal biases aside to ensure an accurate labeling process.
What’s In It for You?
- Be part of a cutting-edge project that will shape the future of content recommendation on Threads.
- Collaborate with a passionate, innovative team dedicated to improving the user experience.
- Gain hands-on experience in the fast-evolving field of social media analysis.
Key Requirements:
- Must be currently located in Taiwan
- Be a native speaker of Chinese
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. By joining Project Calathea, you're playing a key role in shaping a more engaging and authentic social media experience. Together, we can refine the content that users see and help build a platform where originality thrives and misleading content is minimized!

Job Title: Social Media Evaluator (Gig-Worker); Arabic-United States
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Uolo-P. Our project, detecting lies on Social Media, is all about getting people like you involved in finding and researching fake information online. We want to focus on things that happened recently and could cause some real problems if people believe them.
How We Do It:
- Check the Facts: We want you to compare what's said in social media posts with reliable information to see if it's true.
- Keep Up with What's Happening:
- Use Trending Maps: Check maps that show what's popular to guide your searches.
- Watch for Repeat Liars: Find and keep an eye on people or places that often share fake stuff.
- Try Different Ways: Look at other sources and try different methods to find out what's not true.
- What We're Looking For:
For a post to be worth checking, it must:
- Come from social media and be recent (within the last 7 or 14 days).
- Be about something that could seriously fool people, not just little mistakes.
- Not be just someone's opinion, a joke, or a fight between businesses.
What You Need to Show:
- Make sure it doesn't have any made-up info, missing details, or fake pictures.
- Check it's from the last week or two and has at least 15 shares or comments (or 100 views if it's a video).
- Make sure you haven't sent us the same thing before.
- Share the link to the post.
- Give us a link to proof, like a fact-checking site.
- Summarize what the post is saying and how you checked it.
How to Find Stuff to Check:
- Use Google to find out what people are talking about.
- Look at the news on Google to see what's going on.
- Try different searches and look for what's popular.
- Check social media for pages that often share things that aren't true, especially if they're talking about hot topics.
Key Requirements:
- Must be currently located in United States
- Be fluent in Arabic and have proficiency in English
- Must be able to provide your valid social media profile
- Must have an educational degree

Job Title: Language Model Localization and Question Generation Specialist (China)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Fireweed. Project Fireweed is focused on developing a versatile Large Language Model (LLM) that can operate across multiple language domains. The goal is to enhance the model’s ability to understand and generate accurate, contextually appropriate text across different languages and topics. As part of the team, you will play a critical role in improving the model by evaluating domain-specific content and generating complex questions to test the LLM's comprehension and accuracy.
Key Responsibilities: Stage 1: Localization Ranking
- Review articles and content from various domains.
- Assign a localization rating (1-5) based on how local or region-specific the information is.
- Apply consistent and accurate criteria during the ranking process.
Stage 2: Question Generation and Answering
- Create challenging, comprehension-based questions from provided content.
- Ensure questions require synthesis of information, not just recall or extraction.
- Provide clear, concise, and unambiguous answers following set guidelines.
Requirements:
- Attention to Detail: Ability to carefully review content and apply localization criteria accurately.
- Critical Thinking: Strong analytical skills for creating complex questions to test LLM comprehension.
- Language Proficiency: Excellent command of the target language relevant to your workflow.
- Consistency: Ability to consistently apply guidelines in both localization ranking and question generation.
Preferred Qualifications:
- Content Annotation Experience: Prior experience in content evaluation, annotation, or question generation is a plus.
- Familiarity with LLMs: Understanding of LLM functionalities and common challenges in AI comprehension.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. Job Title: Russian Language Model Localization and Question Generation Specialist (Belarus)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Fireweed. Project Fireweed is focused on developing a versatile Large Language Model (LLM) that can operate across multiple language domains. The goal is to enhance the model’s ability to understand and generate accurate, contextually appropriate text across different languages and topics. As part of the team, you will play a critical role in improving the model by evaluating domain-specific content and generating complex questions to test the LLM's comprehension and accuracy.
Key Responsibilities: Stage 1: Localization Ranking
- Review articles and content from various domains.
- Assign a localization rating (1-5) based on how local or region-specific the information is.
- Apply consistent and accurate criteria during the ranking process.
Stage 2: Question Generation and Answering
- Create challenging, comprehension-based questions from provided content.
- Ensure questions require synthesis of information, not just recall or extraction.
- Provide clear, concise, and unambiguous answers following set guidelines.
Requirements:
- Must be located in Belarus
- Must speak Russian
- Attention to Detail: Ability to carefully review content and apply localization criteria accurately.
- Critical Thinking: Strong analytical skills for creating complex questions to test LLM comprehension.
- Language Proficiency: Excellent command of the target language relevant to your workflow.
- Consistency: Ability to consistently apply guidelines in both localization ranking and question generation.
Preferred Qualifications:
- Content Annotation Experience: Prior experience in content evaluation, annotation, or question generation is a plus.
- Familiarity with LLMs: Understanding of LLM functionalities and common challenges in AI comprehension.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
Ready to turn your expertise into a paid opportunity? Apply now to join Project Fireweed and help shape the future of multilingual AI!

Job Title: Translation Specialist – Angaram Project (French-France)
Job Description:
Contribute to the development of innovative AI speech recognition technology at CrowdGen. As a freelance Translation Specialist for Project Angaram, you will translate short speech transcripts, helping to create inclusive and unbiased AI models that break down language barriers.
Key responsibilities:
- Review and revise translations for clarity, coherence, and grammatical accuracy.
- Evaluate machine translations of these transcriptions to help our client improve their audio and text machine translation engine in multiple language pairs.
- Adhere to quality standards and best practices in translation, ensuring high-quality outputs.
Requirements
- Must live in France and be familiar with French.
- Minimum of two years of translation experience.
- Familiarity with Translations/Linguistics concepts
- Ability to work efficiently with provided tools and meet deadlines.
- Experience in machine translation evaluation is a plus
Compensation:
Payment is subject to the number of items submitted. Payrate per item can be seen in your project list.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
By joining this project, you will contribute to the advancement of responsible AI technology, ensuring that speech recognition systems are accurate, inclusive, and free from bias.

Job Title: Spanish Language Model Localization and Question Generation Specialist (Mexico)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Fireweed. Project Fireweed is focused on developing a versatile Large Language Model (LLM) that can operate across multiple language domains. The goal is to enhance the model’s ability to understand and generate accurate, contextually appropriate text across different languages and topics. As part of the team, you will play a critical role in improving the model by evaluating domain-specific content and generating complex questions to test the LLM's comprehension and accuracy.
To make this opportunity even more rewarding, we’re excited to announce that: All pay rates are DOUBLED through October 11, 2024, at 11:59 PM PDT!
This is your chance to maximize your contribution and rewards while shaping the future of multilingual AI.
This is open to everyone, including new applications, so tell your friends and family!
Eligibility Requirements:
The work must be completed by YOU, the qualified contributor invited to work and passed the qualification process on Project Fireweed, and cannot be outsourced.
Your work must meet the minimum quality standard of 80% or higher audit acceptance.
Key Responsibilities: Stage 1: Localization Ranking
- Review articles and content from various domains.
- Assign a localization rating (1-5) based on how local or region-specific the information is.
- Apply consistent and accurate criteria during the ranking process.
Stage 2: Question Generation and Answering
- Create challenging, comprehension-based questions from provided content.
- Ensure questions require synthesis of information, not just recall or extraction.
- Provide clear, concise, and unambiguous answers following set guidelines.
Requirements:
- Native speaker of Spanish language
- Must be located in Mexico
- Attention to Detail: Ability to carefully review content and apply localization criteria accurately.
- Critical Thinking: Strong analytical skills for creating complex questions to test LLM comprehension.
- Language Proficiency: Excellent command of the target language relevant to your workflow.
- Consistency: Ability to consistently apply guidelines in both localization ranking and question generation.
Preferred Qualifications:
- Content Annotation Experience: Prior experience in content evaluation, annotation, or question generation is a plus.
- Familiarity with LLMs: Understanding of LLM functionalities and common challenges in AI comprehension.

Job Title: Bengali AI Voice Recognition Participant [India]
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Daloy. Project Daloy aims to help elevate AI voice recognition technology by contributing unique voices! This is a short-term, remote opportunity where you'll record and submit 100 short phrases or commands, which will be used to improve AI systems. This task is ideal for individuals who enjoy flexible work, have an interest in AI, and want to earn extra income.
Key Responsibilities:
- Record 100 short phrases or commands using your smartphone, following the script provided.
- Ensure each recording is spoken clearly in your local accent.
- Submit recordings for quality review.
Time Commitment:
Approximately 1 hour.
Key Requirements:
- Must be located in India.
- Native speaker of the Bengali language with fluency in English.
- Must be 18 years or older.
- Own an Android or iOS smartphone.
- Ability to follow instructions carefully to meet the quality standards.
Compensation:
- Payment will be provided upon the successful submission of 100 recordings that meet our quality standards.
- Submissions with fewer than 90 recordings will not qualify for payment.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. is focused on developing a versatile Large Language Model (LLM) that can operate across multiple language domains. The goal is to enhance the model’s ability to understand and generate accurate, contextually appropriate text across different languages and topics. As part of the team, you will play a critical role in improving the model by evaluating domain-specific content and generating complex questions to test the LLM's comprehension and accuracy.
We’re excited to announce an even more rewarding opportunity: All pay rates are DOUBLED until October 11, 2024, at 11:59 PM PDT! This is your chance to maximize your contribution and rewards while shaping the future of multilingual AI.
This is open to everyone, including new applications, so tell your friends and family!
Eligibility Requirements:
- The work must be completed by YOU, the qualified contributor invited to work and passed the qualification process on Project Fireweed, and cannot be outsourced.
- Your work must meet the minimum quality standard of 80% or higher audit acceptance.
Key Responsibilities: Stage 1: Localization Ranking
- Review articles and content from various domains.
- Assign a localization rating (1-5) based on how local or region-specific the information is.
- Apply consistent and accurate criteria during the ranking process.
Stage 2: Question Generation and Answering
- Create challenging, comprehension-based questions from provided content.
- Ensure questions require synthesis of information, not just recall or extraction.
- Provide clear, concise, and unambiguous answers following set guidelines.
Requirements:
- Native speaker of
Spanish
language
- Must be located in
Honduras
- Attention to Detail: Ability to carefully review content and apply localization criteria accurately.
- Critical Thinking: Strong analytical skills for creating complex questions to test LLM comprehension.
- Language Proficiency: Excellent command of the target language relevant to your workflow.
- Consistency: Ability to consistently apply guidelines in both localization ranking and question generation.
Preferred Qualifications:
- Content Annotation Experience: Prior experience in content evaluation, annotation, or question generation is a plus.
- Familiarity with LLMs: Understanding of LLM functionalities and common challenges in AI comprehension.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
Ready to turn your expertise into a paid opportunity? Apply now to join Project Fireweed and help shape the future of multilingual AI!

Job Title: Chinese Social Media Evaluator – Clickbait Detection (Taiwan)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Cherry V2. We are seeking a Social Media Evaluator to join our team on a long-term project aimed at assessing whether social media posts contain clickbait content. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and labeling the content of social media posts to determine if they meet the criteria for clickbait.
Key Responsibilities:
- Review and evaluate social media posts, identifying potential clickbait content.
- Label posts based on specific guidelines and criteria for clickbait.
- Ensure accuracy and consistency in evaluations.
Requirements:
- Must be located in Taiwan
- Must be native speaker of Chinese
- Strong attention to detail and the ability to make nuanced judgments.
- Familiarity with social media platforms and trends.
- Ability to follow guidelines for labeling and evaluating content.
- Reliable internet connection for remote work.
Project Details:
- Long-term commitment with ongoing tasks.
- Flexible working hours.
- Approximately 20 hours per week of availability.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
If you have a passion for social media and the ability to analyze and evaluate content effectively, we’d love to hear from you!

Job Title: Fachkraft für die Lokalisierung von Sprachmodellen und Erstellung von Fragen auf Deutsch (Belgien)
Job Description:
Verdiene $44 pro Stunde dank unserer VERDOPPELTEN Vergütungssätze bis zum 15. Oktober 2024 um 23:59 Uhr PDT! Dies ist deine Chance, deinen Beitrag und deine Belohnungen zu maximieren, während du die Zukunft der mehrsprachigen KI gestaltest.
Werden Sie Teil des CrowdGen-Teams als unabhängiger Auftragnehmer für das Projekt Fireweed. Projekt Fireweed konzentriert sich auf die Entwicklung eines vielseitigen Large Language Model (LLM), das über mehrere Sprachdomänen hinweg operieren kann. Ziel ist es, die Fähigkeit des Modells zu verbessern, korrekten, kontextabhängigen Text über verschiedene Sprachen und Themen hinweg zu verstehen und zu generieren. Als Teil des Teams spielen Sie eine entscheidende Rolle bei der Verbesserung des Modells, indem Sie domänenspezifische Inhalte bewerten und komplexe Fragen generieren, um das Verständnis und die Genauigkeit des LLM zu testen.
Dies ist offen für alle, auch für neue Anwendungen, also erzählen Sie es Ihren Freunden und Familie!
Zulassungsvoraussetzungen:
Die Arbeit muss von IHNEN, dem zur Arbeit eingeladenen qualifizierten Mitwirkenden, abgeschlossen und den Qualifizierungsprozess für Project Fireweed bestanden haben und kann nicht ausgelagert werden.
Ihre Arbeit muss den Mindestqualitätsstandard von 80% oder höher Audit Akzeptanz erfüllen.
Schlüsselaufgaben: Stufe 1: Lokalisierungsranking
Überprüfen Sie Artikel und Inhalte aus verschiedenen Bereichen.
Vergeben Sie eine Lokalisierungsbewertung (1-5) basierend darauf, wie lokal oder regionalspezifisch die Informationen sind.
Wenden Sie konsistente und genaue Kriterien während des Ranking-Prozesses an.
Stufe 2: Fragegenerierung und Beantwortung
Erstellen Sie anspruchsvolle, verständliche Fragen aus bereitgestellten Inhalten.
Stellen Sie sicher, dass Fragen eine Synthese von Informationen erfordern, nicht nur Rückruf oder Extraktion.
Stellen Sie klare, prägnante und eindeutige Antworten nach festgelegten Richtlinien bereit.
Voraussetzungen:
Deutschmuttersprachler
Muss sich in Belgien befinden
Liebe zum Detail: Fähigkeit, Inhalte sorgfältig zu überprüfen und Lokalisierungskriterien genau anzuwenden.
Kritisches Denken: Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten zur Erstellung komplexer Fragestellungen zur Prüfung des LLM-Verständnisses.
Sprachkenntnisse: Exzellente Beherrschung der für Ihren Workflow relevanten Zielsprache.
Konsistenz: Fähigkeit, Richtlinien sowohl im Lokalisierungsranking als auch bei der Fragegenerierung konsequent anzuwenden.
Vorzugsqualifikationen:
Content Annotation Experience: Vorkenntnisse in der Inhaltsbewertung, Anmerkung oder Fragengenerierung sind von Vorteil.
Vertrautheit mit LLMs: Verständnis von LLM-Funktionalitäten und gemeinsamen Herausforderungen im KI-Verständnis.
Diese Rolle ist eine projektbasierte Chance bei CrowdGen, wo Sie als unabhängiger Auftragnehmer der CrowdGen Community beitreten werden. Wenn ausgewählt, erhalten Sie von CrowdGen eine E-Mail über die Einrichtung eines Kontos unter Verwendung Ihrer Bewerbungs-E-Mail-Adresse. Sie müssen sich bei diesem Konto anmelden und das Passwort zurücksetzen, die Setup-Voraussetzungen erfüllen und mit Ihrer Bewerbung für diese projektbasierte Rolle fortfahren.
Sind Sie bereit, Ihre Expertise in eine bezahlte Chance zu verwandeln? Bewerben Sie sich jetzt bei Project Fireweed und gestalten Sie die Zukunft der mehrsprachigen KI mit!ual AI!

Job Title: Fachkraft für die Lokalisierung von Sprachmodellen und Erstellung von Fragen auf Deutsch (Schweiz)
Job Description:
Verdiene $64.18 pro Stunde dank unserer VERDOPPELTEN Vergütungssätze bis zum 15. Oktober 2024 um 23:59 Uhr PDT! Dies ist deine Chance, deinen Beitrag und deine Belohnungen zu maximieren, während du die Zukunft der mehrsprachigen KI gestaltest.
Werden Sie Teil des CrowdGen-Teams als unabhängiger Auftragnehmer für das Projekt Fireweed. Projekt Fireweed konzentriert sich auf die Entwicklung eines vielseitigen Large Language Model (LLM), das über mehrere Sprachdomänen hinweg operieren kann. Ziel ist es, die Fähigkeit des Modells zu verbessern, korrekten, kontextabhängigen Text über verschiedene Sprachen und Themen hinweg zu verstehen und zu generieren. Als Teil des Teams spielen Sie eine entscheidende Rolle bei der Verbesserung des Modells, indem Sie domänenspezifische Inhalte bewerten und komplexe Fragen generieren, um das Verständnis und die Genauigkeit des LLM zu testen.
Dies ist offen für alle, auch für neue Anwendungen, also erzählen Sie es Ihren Freunden und Familie!
Zulassungsvoraussetzungen:
Die Arbeit muss von IHNEN, dem zur Arbeit eingeladenen qualifizierten Mitwirkenden, abgeschlossen und den Qualifizierungsprozess für Project Fireweed bestanden haben und kann nicht ausgelagert werden.
Ihre Arbeit muss den Mindestqualitätsstandard von 80% oder höher Audit Akzeptanz erfüllen.
Schlüsselaufgaben: Stufe 1: Lokalisierungsranking
Überprüfen Sie Artikel und Inhalte aus verschiedenen Bereichen.
Vergeben Sie eine Lokalisierungsbewertung (1-5) basierend darauf, wie lokal oder regionalspezifisch die Informationen sind.
Wenden Sie konsistente und genaue Kriterien während des Ranking-Prozesses an.
Stufe 2: Fragegenerierung und Beantwortung
Erstellen Sie anspruchsvolle, verständliche Fragen aus bereitgestellten Inhalten.
Stellen Sie sicher, dass Fragen eine Synthese von Informationen erfordern, nicht nur Rückruf oder Extraktion.
Stellen Sie klare, prägnante und eindeutige Antworten nach festgelegten Richtlinien bereit.

Deutschmuttersprachler
Muss sich in der Schweiz befinden
