Job Title: German Freelance Transcription Specialist (German)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Derwent. Help improve machine learning by working as a transcriber for the Derwent project. As a transcriber, you will listen to audio files in German and accurately transcribe what you hear, following specific guidelines and conventions. Your work will directly contribute to the development and refinement of machine learning models.
Key Responsibilities:
- Listen to audio files in German.
- Transcribe audio content according to the provided guidelines.
- Ensure high accuracy and consistency in your transcriptions.
Job Details:
- Compensation: $16 - $17 USD per hour on average (actual earnings may vary depending on the number of items completed per hour).
- Flexible hours; work at your own pace.
Requirements:
- Must live in Germany.
- Must be a native speaker of German.
- Must pass a project qualification quiz.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
Apply Now and help advance machine learning technologies by contributing your language expertise!

Job Title: Indonesian Speaker Diarization Specialist (Indonesia)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Eura Speaker Diarization.
Job Overview:
Join our team in helping to build cutting-edge, AI-powered speech recognition technology! We are looking for native Indonesian speakers currently residing in Indonesia to work as transcribers on the Eura Speaker Diarization project. This flexible role allows you to work at your own pace, reviewing audio files, identifying speakers, and adding timestamps for speaker turns.
Key Responsibilities:
- Listen to audio files and review transcriptions for accuracy.
- Identify and label speakers and speaker turns by adding timestamps.
- Work with flexible hours and submit completed audio based on your availability.
Compensation:
- Payment is based on the actual duration of the audio you submit.
- Pay rate is calculated for every 3600 seconds (1 hour) of audio completed.
- Transcribers typically complete around 4 minutes of audio in 60 minutes after becoming familiar with project guidelines, tools, and data.
Requirements:
- Native speaker of Indonesian.
- Currently residing in Indonesia.
- Successfully pass the relevant language certification quiz.
- Pass the project’s qualification quiz.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
Help shape the future of AI-powered speech recognition! Apply today and work on your own schedule with Project Eura Speaker Diarization.

Job Title: 中文模型本地化和问题生成专家
Job Description:
通过我们的双倍支付率，赚取每小时14.40-26.00美元，直到2024年10月15日晚上11:59（太平洋夏令时间）！这是您最大化贡献和奖励的机会，同时塑造多语言人工智能的未来。
加入 CrowdGen 团队，成为 Fireweed 项目的独立承包商。Fireweed 项目专注于开发一个多功能的大型语言模型 (LLM)，该模型可以跨多个语言领域运行。目标是增强模型理解和生成准确、符合上下文的文本的能力，这些文本可以跨不同的语言和主题。作为团队的一员，您将通过评估特定领域的内容和生成复杂的问题来测试 LLM 的理解力和准确性，在改进模型方面发挥关键作用。
这对所有人开放，包括新申请者，所以告诉你的朋友和家人吧！
资格要求：
- 工作必须由您完成，您是受邀工作并通过了 Fireweed 项目资格审查流程的合格贡献者，并且不能外包。
- 您的工作必须达到最低质量标准，即 80% 或更高的审计接受度。
主要职责：第 1 阶段：本地化排名
- 审查来自各个领域的文章和内容。
- 根据信息的本地化程度或区域特定程度分配本地化评级 (1-5)。
- 在排名过程中应用一致且准确的标准。
第 2 阶段：问题生成和回答
- 根据提供的内容创建具有挑战性的、基于理解的问题。
- 确保问题需要综合信息，而不仅仅是回忆或提取。
- 按照既定准则提供清晰、简洁和明确的答案。
要求：
- 中文 语言的母语人士
- 关注细节：能够仔细审查内容并准确应用本地化标准。
- 批判性思维：强大的分析能力，可以创建复杂的问题来测试 LLM 理解力。
- 语言能力：精通与您的工作流程相关的目标语言。
- 一致性：能够在本地化排名和问题生成中始终如一地应用指导方针。
首选资格：
- 内容注释经验：具有内容评估、注释或问题生成方面的经验者优先。
- 熟悉 LLM：了解 LLM 功能和 AI 理解中的常见挑战。
此职位是 CrowdGen 的一个基于项目的机会，您将以独立承包商的身份加入 CrowdGen 社区。如果被选中，您将收到 CrowdGen 发送的电子邮件，其中说明使用您的申请电子邮件地址创建帐户。您需要登录此帐户并重置密码，完成设置要求，然后继续申请此基于项目的职位。
准备好将您的专业知识转化为有偿机会了吗？立即申请加入 Project Fireweed 并帮助塑造多语言 AI 的未来！

Job Title: Danish Voice Recording Participant (Denmark)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Lenox. Help us transform the way we communicate—your voice is crucial in this groundbreaking journey! We are looking for native Danish speakers to participate in a simple and quick task that involves reading and recording two short sentences aloud using our Appen Mobile App.
The task takes approximately 10 minutes to complete, and you'll be compensated competitively for your time and effort.
Requirements:
- Must be 18 years old or older
- Own an Android or iOS device with working recording capabilities
- Speak at a natural pace
- Must be a native Danish speaker residing in Denmark
Payment: Payment is provided per accepted unit, where 1 unit consists of completing a session with two sentence recordings. Both recordings must pass our quality check based on provided guidelines to receive payment.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
Additional Information: Once selected for the task, you will receive a welcome email with your app login details (PIN). You will have 24-48 hours to complete the task, after which the PIN will expire and the task may be reassigned.
Join us in this exciting project and help shape the future of communication!

Job Title: Social Media Evaluator (Content Analyst); Japanese-Japan
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Calathea.
Do you love exploring Threads? Then, this project is tailor-made for you!
About the Project:
Project Calathea is dedicated to enhancing the Threads recommendation ecosystem by diving into the world of content analysis. We’re collecting labels for key attributes like originality, bait, and other objective elements specific to threads. Your contributions will play a vital role in measuring these attributes accurately and building a robust classifier that will help refine the recommendation system, improving the user experience for millions.
Who Are We Looking For?:
We’re seeking passionate individuals with a deep interest in social media and content analysis. Ideal candidates will possess the following:
- Critical Thinking: Ability to assess and evaluate the content of threads, determining whether they are original, bait, or contain other objective attributes.
- Attention to Detail: A sharp eye for examining the subtle nuances in posts to ensure accurate labeling. Small differences can be crucial in distinguishing between types of content.
- Understanding of Social Media Dynamics: Familiarity with how platforms like Threads work, including the types of posts, trends, and what makes content engaging or misleading.
- Objectivity and Impartiality: The ability to judge content fairly, setting personal biases aside to ensure an accurate labeling process.
What’s In It for You?
- Be part of a cutting-edge project that will shape the future of content recommendation on Threads.
- Collaborate with a passionate, innovative team dedicated to improving the user experience.
- Gain hands-on experience in the fast-evolving field of social media analysis.
Key Requirements:
- Must be currently located in Japan
- Be a native speaker of Japanese
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. By joining Project Calathea, you're playing a key role in shaping a more engaging and authentic social media experience. Together, we can refine the content that users see and help build a platform where originality thrives and misleading content is minimized!

Job Title: Social Media Evaluator (E-commerce Shopping); Mexico
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Lyra.
Are you ready for a fun and engaging way to put your shopping skills to the test? Become a Mystery Shopper for an instant messaging platform and help us evaluate the e-commerce shopping experience!
✅ TASK:
- As a Mystery Shopper, you’ll shop online from the comfort of your home, purchase products, and provide valuable feedback through surveys about your experience.
✅ REQUIREMENTS:
- You should have the funds to purchase products (up to a maximum of $500/month, no minimum required)
- Be fluent in English
- Have excellent attention to detail
- Be able to shop online using credit or debit cards, PayPal, GCash, digital wallets, etc.
- Currently residing in Mexico
✅ PAYMENT:
- You'll be paid for completing surveys and reimbursed for your purchases, plus you get to keep all the items you buy! Just make sure your submission meets our quality guidelines to qualify for reimbursement.

Job Title: Transcription Specialist - Numbat Project (Mandarin Language)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Numbat. As a Transcription Specialist for the Numbat project, you will play a key role in contributing to the development of cutting-edge AI-powered speech recognition models. Your task is to provide accurate and high-quality transcriptions following specific guidelines and tagging conventions. The transcriptions you produce will support the creation of inclusive and unbiased AI technologies that enhance communication across languages, dialects, accents, and modes of communication.
Key Responsibilities:
- Transcribe audio recordings in the Mandarin language (Wuhan, Dongbei and Shanghai dialects) with a focus on accuracy and adherence to guidelines.
- Apply specified tagging conventions and make any necessary annotations.
- Deliver transcriptions that support the development of advanced AI speech recognition models.
- Ensure high-quality output in line with project expectations and AI specialist standards.
Requirements:
- Must live in China and be familiar with one of these dialects: Wuhan, Dongbei and Shanghai
- Attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality work.
- Familiarity with transcription guidelines or willingness to learn.
- Ability to work efficiently with provided tools and meet deadlines.
Compensation:
Payments will be based on the actual duration of the audio you submit. The displayed pay rate corresponds to what you would earn for completing and submitting 3,600 seconds (1 hour) of audio. Once familiar with the guidelines, data, and tools, most transcribers are expected to transcribe 12 minutes of audio within 60 minutes.

Job Title: Dutch Social Media Evaluator – Clickbait Detection (Netherlands)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Cherry V2. We are seeking a Social Media Evaluator to join our team on a long-term project aimed at assessing whether social media posts contain clickbait content. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and labeling the content of social media posts to determine if they meet the criteria for clickbait.
Key Responsibilities:
- Review and evaluate social media posts, identifying potential clickbait content.
- Label posts based on specific guidelines and criteria for clickbait.
- Ensure accuracy and consistency in evaluations.
Requirements:
- Must be located in Netherlands
- Must be native speaker of Dutch
- Strong attention to detail and the ability to make nuanced judgments.
- Familiarity with social media platforms and trends.
- Ability to follow guidelines for labeling and evaluating content.
- Reliable internet connection for remote work.
Project Details:
- Long-term commitment with ongoing tasks.
- Flexible working hours.
- Approximately 20 hours per week of availability.

Job Title: Mali AI Transcription Specialist (Bambara)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Vicuna. Join our team to help build AI-powered speech recognition and moderation models! By working on this project, you will contribute to the development of responsible, unbiased AI technology.
As an AI Transcription Specialist, you will be responsible for producing highly accurate transcriptions of speech in Bambara. Your efforts will play a key role in improving AI-powered communication tools. This project focuses on developing advanced speech recognition models for the Bambara language.
Key Responsibilities:
- Accurately transcribe audio files in Bambara, following the provided transcription guidelines.
- Ensure high-quality transcriptions to help develop AI speech recognition models.
- Apply linguistic knowledge to ensure correct spelling, grammar, and pronunciation.
Requirements:
- Must be based in Mali.
- Native proficiency in Bambara (required).
- Bilingual skills in French and/or Arabic (preferred).
- Strong attention to detail and an understanding of basic linguistic concepts.
- Good reading comprehension skills in both Bambara and English.
- Ability to follow guidelines and apply rules to data accurately.
- Familiarity with Bambara spelling conventions.
- Prior experience in transcription and annotation of acoustic data.
- Stable internet connection.
- Experience with online gaming is a plus but not required.
Qualification Process:
Bambara Language Proficiency: You must pass a language comprehension quiz with a score of at least 80% (3 attempts allowed).
Transcription Guidelines Quiz: You must score at least 85% on a medium-complexity transcription guidelines quiz (2 attempts allowed).

Job Title: French Voice Recording Participant (Belgium)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Lenox. Help us transform the way we communicate—your voice is crucial in this groundbreaking journey! We are looking for native French speakers to participate in a simple and quick task that involves reading and recording two short sentences aloud using our Appen Mobile App.
The task takes approximately 10 minutes to complete, and you'll be compensated competitively for your time and effort.
Requirements:
- Must be 18 years old or older
- Own an Android or iOS device with working recording capabilities
- Speak at a natural pace
- Must be a native French speaker residing in Belgium
Payment: Payment is provided per accepted unit, where 1 unit consists of completing a session with two sentence recordings. Both recordings must pass our quality check based on provided guidelines to receive payment.

Job Title: Arabic Language Model Localization and Question Generation Specialist
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Fireweed. Project Fireweed is focused on developing a versatile Large Language Model (LLM) that can operate across multiple language domains. The goal is to enhance the model’s ability to understand and generate accurate, contextually appropriate text across different languages and topics. As part of the team, you will play a critical role in improving the model by evaluating domain-specific content and generating complex questions to test the LLM's comprehension and accuracy.
This is open to everyone, including new applications, so tell your friends and family!
Eligibility Requirements:
- The work must be completed by YOU, the qualified contributor invited to work and passed the qualification process on Project Fireweed, and cannot be outsourced.
- Your work must meet the minimum quality standard of 80% or higher audit acceptance.
Key Responsibilities: Stage 1: Localization Ranking
- Review articles and content from various domains.
- Assign a localization rating (1-5) based on how local or region-specific the information is.
- Apply consistent and accurate criteria during the ranking process.
Stage 2: Question Generation and Answering
- Create challenging, comprehension-based questions from provided content.
- Ensure questions require synthesis of information, not just recall or extraction.
- Provide clear, concise, and unambiguous answers following set guidelines.
Requirements:
- Native speaker of Arabic language
- Attention to Detail: Ability to carefully review content and apply localization criteria accurately.
- Critical Thinking: Strong analytical skills for creating complex questions to test LLM comprehension.
- Language Proficiency: Excellent command of the target language relevant to your workflow.
- Consistency: Ability to consistently apply guidelines in both localization ranking and question generation.
Preferred Qualifications:
- Content Annotation Experience: Prior experience in content evaluation, annotation, or question generation is a plus.
- Familiarity with LLMs: Understanding of LLM functionalities and common challenges in AI comprehension.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
Ready to turn your expertise into a paid opportunity? Apply now to join Project Fireweed and help shape the future of multilingual AI!

Job Title: English AI Prompt Writer and Response Reviewer Specialist (United States)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Vuoksi.
We are seeking a Text-Based AI Instruction Specialist to join our innovative project focused on refining and enhancing the capabilities of advanced text-based AI. This role involves creating and refining instructions for the AI, ensuring it accurately understands and generates human language.
Do you have a passion for creativity and a knack for detail? This isn’t your typical writing job. You’ll be part of a groundbreaking project where the goal is to inspire an AI with diverse, engaging, and meaningful prompts that real users might enter into a chatbot. Think outside the box, get creative, and have fun while ensuring everything aligns with our content guidelines!
Key Responsibilities:
- Get Creative: Write imaginative, unique prompts and refine commands for the AI to improve its language understanding and generation.
- Shape AI Responses: Review and evaluate AI responses to ensure accuracy and appropriateness.
- Ensure Diversity: Develop a wide variety of questions and topics to simulate potential user interactions, ensuring all content is varied and free from harmful or biased material.
- High-Quality Content: Produce high-quality, original written content without any plagiarism, and proofread and edit meticulously to eliminate misspellings and grammatical errors.
- Guideline Guru: Understand and apply complex guidelines and requirements effectively.
What We’re Looking For:
- Native English Speaker: Must be a fluent English speaker with excellent writing skills.
- U.S. Residency: Must be currently residing in the United States.
- Creative Thinker: You love coming up with original ideas and pushing the limits of what’s possible.
- Detail-Oriented: You’ve got the keen eye of a proofreader and notice things others might miss.
Why Join Us?
- Innovative Work: Be part of a project that’s at the cutting edge of AI technology.
- Flexibility: Work remotely on your own schedule—ideal for creatives and freelancers alike!
- Impact: Play a key role in developing AI that helps people engage with technology in a more meaningful way.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
If you’re ready to bring your creativity to life in a role that blends innovation with writing, we’d love to hear from you!

Job Title: Mathematics Prompt Generation and Annotation Specialist (English)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Aristotle. We are looking for a Mathematics expert to generate complex, skill-based prompts and annotate AI responses for accuracy. This role focuses on creating mathematical problems that challenge the latest AI models, ensuring they require advanced reasoning and involve multiple mathematical skills.
Key Responsibilities:
- Mathematics-Focused Prompt Generation: Create prompts based on pairs of mathematical skills (e.g., geometry and algebra) that are complex enough to challenge advanced AI models like GPT-40.
- Annotation of AI Responses: Review AI model responses, which are provided in a step-by-step format, and identify errors in mathematical reasoning or computation.
- Skill Integration: Ensure each prompt meaningfully incorporates both mathematical skills, requiring the model to use them in non-trivial ways.
- Refinement of AI Models: Provide detailed feedback on model performance and help improve AI accuracy in solving mathematical problems.
Qualifications:
- Must be a native speaker of English
- Strong background in Mathematics, ideally with a degree in the field.
- Experience with creating or solving complex mathematical problems.
- Ability to identify errors and explain mathematical concepts clearly.
- Familiarity with AI/ML models is a plus.
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
This role is ideal for someone with deep mathematical knowledge who wants to contribute to the development of AI systems.

- Strong background in Biology, ideally with an advanced degree in the field.
- Experience creating or solving complex Biology problems across different domains (e.g., molecular biology, ecology, evolutionary biology).
- Ability to spot and explain errors in biological reasoning or data interpretation.
- Familiarity with AI/ML models and their limitations is a plus.

Job Title: Become a Bashkir Audio Transcription Specialist! (Kazakhstan)
Job Description:
Join us in revolutionizing human-computer interaction through Bashkir audio transcription! We’re seeking talented individuals to ensure our transcribed texts accurately reflect the audio content, covering various engaging topics like daily life, sports, education, and more.
Background:
This exciting project aims to establish a comprehensive audio database for Bashkir, enhancing how we interact with technology. Your contributions will directly impact user experiences across multiple fields!
Project Period:
October to December (3 months)
Compensation:
Annotator: $41 per valid audio hour
Quality Assurance (QA): $30 per valid audio hour
Career Progression:
Annotator > Quality Inspector > Supervisor (limited positions available)
Key Responsibilities:
As an Annotator:
- Carefully transcribe audio according to guidelines and submit your work.
- Collaborate on modifications based on quality feedback.
As a Quality Inspector (QA):
- Evaluate and enhance the quality of annotations.
- Provide constructive feedback to annotators for improvement.
- Return low-level errors to annotators for correction without extended assistance.
As a Supervisor:
- Receive additional compensation for management responsibilities.
- Train new team members on platform operations and procedures.
- Answer questions and provide guidance, leading regular review meetings.
- Monitor and assess team quality, selecting newly qualified annotators and inspectors.
- Assist the Project Manager in managing team dynamics, including notifications, data conditions, and feedback.
What We Need:
- Native speaker of Bashkir.
- Experience in transcription.
- Strong reading comprehension skills in English.
- Ability to commit 3-4 hours of work per day.
Ready to make a significant impact in the world of audio transcription? Apply today and be a part of our innovative team!

Job Title: Tatar Language Evaluator (Vistula); Kazakhstan
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Vistula.
Are you a native Tatar speaker living in Kazakhstan? Would you like to help shape the future of machine translation technology while working on your own schedule, from anywhere? Project Vistula is looking for people just like you to help improve the quality of translations in one of the world’s leading translation engines!
About the Role: As a member of Project Vistula, you will play a key role in ensuring that Tatar, a rich and historic language, is accurately represented in modern technology. You'll evaluate machine translations from and into Tatar, providing feedback to help fine-tune the system. Your insights will directly impact the quality of translations that millions of people around the world rely on.
And the best part? No prior experience is needed. You don’t need to be a professional translator—just a native speaker with a keen eye for detail and a passion for language. If you speak other languages as well, you can contribute even more by evaluating translations in those languages too!
Why Join Us?
- Work whenever, wherever: This is a completely flexible, remote position. Fit it around your lifestyle and availability—there are no set hours or long-term commitments.
- Make a global impact: Your feedback will help refine cutting-edge technology, benefiting speakers of your language and others worldwide.
- Be part of something meaningful: Help ensure that the Tatar language is accurately represented in one of the most widely used translation engines in the world.
- Contribute in multiple languages: If you’re fluent in other languages, you can work across more than just Tatar.
What You’ll Need:
- Native fluency in Tatar.
- Currently living in Kazakhstan.
- A reliable internet connection.
- A sharp eye for detail and accuracy.
This is your chance to work on something meaningful, flexible, and impactful—all while doing something you already love: engaging with your native language!
This role is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen regarding the creation of an account using your application email address. You will need to log in to this account and reset the password, complete the setup requirements, and proceed with your application for this project-based role.
Ready to make a difference? Don’t miss out on this exciting opportunity to be part of Project Vistula and shape the future of machine translation.

Join us in making a difference in language processing. Your voice matters!

Job Title: Calling All Native Tatar Speakers with Transcription Experience! (Tatar-Poland)
Job Description:
Exciting Opportunity: Join Our Audio Transcription Project!
We are seeking passionate native Tatar speakers in Poland with transcription experience and strong English reading comprehension skills.
Project Overview:
This project aims to establish an audio database for your target language, enhancing human-computer interaction across various fields, including daily life, sports, entertainment, education, travel, shopping, and digital time.
Project Details:
- Duration: October to December (3 months)
- Compensation: $41 per valid audio hour for annotators; $30 per valid audio hour for quality assurance (QA) roles.
- Career Progression: Opportunities to advance from Annotator to Quality Inspector to Supervisor.
Roles and Responsibilities:
As an Annotator:
- Carefully complete each transcription according to the guidelines and submit your work.
- Collaborate promptly on any modifications based on quality inspection feedback.
As a Quality Inspector (QA):
- Review and ensure the quality of data submitted by annotators.
- Provide constructive feedback and assist annotators in correcting errors.
- Identify repeated or low-level errors and send the work back for modifications without additional time spent on minor fixes.
As a Supervisor:
- Train and support newly added team members on platform operations and task management.
- Answer queries, emphasize key points, and lead regular review meetings.
- Maintain a roster of qualified annotators and inspectors and assist the project manager in team management.
Requirements:
- Native speaker of Tatar.
- Experience in transcription.
- Strong English reading comprehension skills.
- Ability to commit to 3-4 work hours per day.
Join us in this rewarding project and contribute to a meaningful initiative that will shape the future of human-computer interaction!
We need your expertise to make a difference!

Job Title: Mandarin Chinese Image Data Contributor (Huron); Canada
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project Huron.
In this project, your primary responsibility is to find and upload images that match predefined categories, then generate a corresponding question or prompt for each image. Some categories include documents, diagrams, infographics, and other similar materials. This data collection will contribute to enhancing the multilingual image interpretation capabilities of a Large Language Model (LLM).
Responsibilities:
- Locate and upload images across specified categories.
- Create clear, contextually appropriate questions or prompts for each image in your native language.
- Ensure image content is relevant, diverse, and accurately categorized.
Requirements:
- Native proficiency in Mandarin Chinese, with strong fluency in English.
- Strong writing skills in your native language, with attention to grammar, spelling, and punctuation.
- Ability to work independently and efficiently, maintaining high standards for quality.
- Currently residing in Canada.
Compensation:
Payment is provided per successfully submitted and accepted image and question (prompt) pair. On average, each pair should take around 20 minutes to complete, which could translate to approximately $15 per hour, assuming three pairs are completed in 60 minutes. The pay rate listed reflects the payment for a single image and question pair.

Job Title: Native Kabyle Speaker for Audio Recording Project (Algeria)
Job Description:
Join the CrowdGen team as an Independent Contractor for Project A10350 Kabyle Native Speaker Recording. We are seeking native Kabyle speakers from Algeria to participate in a language recording project aimed at enhancing language technology. Participants will record a series of sentences in Kabyle to provide authentic audio samples.
Key Requirements:
- Native Language: Kabyle, with a standard accent
- Age Range: 18-60 years old
- Recording Conditions: Quiet, controlled environment with clear audio quality and minimal background noise
Task Details: Record up to 1,000 sentences, with each recording lasting between 4-7 seconds. Silence of 1-2 seconds before and after each sentence is required.
Recording Guidelines:
- Natural Speech: Deliver sentences in a smooth, conversational tone without unnecessary pauses or stammering.
- Moderate Volume: Speak at a natural volume, maintaining clarity without being too loud or too soft.
- Consistency: Each participant should complete their assigned recordings independently to maintain consistency.
Payment: Compensation is based on the number of qualifying, accepted recordings, with a rate of $0.058 USD per sentence.
